channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-1431] Typo in link to Simple Example from frameworks/readme.html
item.description:
There is a small typo in frameworks/readme.html.

The link "see the simple example" links to

../demo/programs/simple/example.html

but it should link to

../demo/simple/example.html

because there is no "programs" folder in the "demo" subtree.

I'm attaching a patch for review.
item.summary: Typo in link to Simple Example from frameworks/readme.html

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attached patch "docPatch.diff" fixes the HTML link to simple example.

The -bin distribution in 10.2 currently does build with a demo/programs directory. With the addition of toursdb to demo/databases, I've moved the demo programs into demo/programs. I only did so because that was the hierarchy in the past. But maybe it would be simpler to move everything (including toursdb) back into the top-level demo folder and not have an extra level of hierarchy for 10.2. Opinions?

I like to plan for success. To me that means, in this case, many more demo programs, databases, etc. in the this directory. Soon I will be submitting a patch with the sample programs that go with the Working With Derby document and liked it when I saw the new structure. So cast my vote for organizing/grouping files in a hierarchy under the demo folder.

Hi Stan and Andrew, thanks for the feedback! I completely agree that a richer folder
structure for the demo materials is superior.

However, I'm still puzzled: all 3 of the zip files that I downloaded: 10.2, 10.1.2,
and 10.1.3, just contained a simple 'demo' folder, and did not contain the 'programs'
and 'databases' sub-folders.

Am I looking in the wrong place? Or is there a build/packaging problem in the
distribution process which is causing the downloadable zip files to have an unexpected
folder structure?

For example, I downloaded "Derby 10.2.0.3 alpha (June 6, 2006 / SVN 412239)"
from http://db.apache.org/derby/binaries/db-derby-snapshot-10.2.0.3-412239.zip
as described on http://db.apache.org/derby/derby_downloads.html#Snapshot+Jars

In that zip file, I do not see any demo/programs directory. Nor do I see a
demo/databases directory.

Under "demo", I see only: nserverdemo, simple, and toursdb.

Am I misunderstanding your comment? When you access a 10.2 distribution are
you getting a zip file which has a demo/programs directory?

The snapshots are created by a different target than the release distributions. The snapshots are created by the top-level 'snapshot' target while the release distributions are created by the 'release' target in tools/release/build.xml. The top-level snapshot target should probably be changed to match the target in tools/release, or the demos should be removed from the snapshots.

I'm more in favor of removing the demos from the snapshots than fixing the path inside the snapshot, in order to make the snapshot look less like a real release, but I'm curious to hear what others think.

Noticed this was still in the patch queue. I'm attaching an alternate patch for this issue in order to revive this discussion. I am of the opinion that it is better that the snapshots contain fewer items in order to make them look less like a release, and that instead of somehow fixing the demo html or the demo paths in the snapshot so that the doc is correct, I propose we remove the demos from the snapshots.

Hi Andrew, thanks for looking at this.

Your suggestion is fine with me, but I think we also have to take the link to the demo out of frameworks/readme.html.
Attaching updated patch which removes the link from frameworks/readme.html which would be broken in the snapshot but correct in the -bin distribution.

I think derby-1431-alt2.diff is fine, and it addresses my problem completely, as well as also simplifying the snapshot. Marking the issue as assigned to Andrew to reflect that I think we should go with his patch, not my original one.
This issue has been resolved for over a year with no further movement. Closing.
